content.description: One of the harder problems on the boulder, and one of the lowest. Starts on a big, sloping rail on the southwest side of the rock. Requires a difficult move or two to gain the flake, and then another strenuous move yarding on the flake to gain the top.
content.protection: Pad optional, the crux is very low.
content.location: Southwest corner of the rock, just right of the tree on the big sloping rail.

content.description: Climb the crack with good feet and good holds.
content.location: The obvious crack running up the center of the southeast side of the boulder.

content.description:
Shares a sit start with the direct V2 on big holds, but instead of going up, move left across a series of edges to reach the wide crack. The traverse moves don't have much in the way of feet and some power is required to motor through them. Finish on

Easy Edger.
content.protection: Optional pad for the traverse crux as it is very low and has a good landing.
content.location:
Shares a start with

Big Stuff

​​​​ on big holds on the west side of the boulder. Finishes on the easier line just right of the wide crack on the northwest side.

content.description: Stand start on left side pulls and right crimps. Work your way up the arête feature with a sequence of compression moves to reach the good holds up top. Using the detached boulder to the right would probably lower the grade.
content.location: Left of the wide crack on the northwest side of the boulder.

content.description:
Better variation of

Three Minute Lizard Fight

. Starts on

Easy Edger

, but moves immediately out right to the big edge. From here, go straight up with a big, blind move to the crimps on the light-colored slab.

I found the flow of this problem to be much better than the original, as the feet work a little better when heading right, and the finish is much more interesting.
content.protection: One pad for the top-put, another one optional for the traverse as the landing is perfect and you can easily step off.
content.location:
Start on

Easy Edger

and finish on

Big Stuff.

content.description:
Tricky compression and arête slapping problem. Start on good side pulling holds with a big foot ledge and work up the white dike to top it out. A lower start is possible by matching on a sloping rail on the right face before coming into the start holds for a small bump in difficulty.

One of the best problems at this boulder.
content.location: Southeast corner of the boulder. The dike feature is clearly visible near the top of the arête.

content.description:
Stand start on really nice, comfortable edges. Unfortunately, the perfect edges are ruined by an awkward topout up and left with a messy landing situation.

The rock surrounding the problem is quite mossy but the edges and feet are very clean.

"Unnamed V2" in the book.
content.protection: A couple of pads are nice to protect the ground and the rock behind.
content.location: Southside of the boulders, in the wide gap on the right face.

content.description: Slabby finger crack in a mossy corner. Though the corner looks terribly dirty, the good parts of the finger crack and the feet are mostly clean. The crux is topping this one out, and falling would be ugly due to the height and angle.
content.protection: Pad, though slipping off the topout would probably jostle you along the slab below. Better not to fall at the top.
content.location: Dirty corner on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Step up on a ledge, go up to the triangle-shaped jug, then continue with some more technical movement off a couple of not-so-great slimpers and some smaller feet to gain the easier topout.
content.location:
Immediately right of the

Phallic Tractor

arête on the southeast side of the boulder.

content.description: Quality, technical slab bouldering using a thin dike in the center of the face. The top is committing and a fall would probably suck due to the angle, height, and a rocky ledge jutting out near the landing.
content.protection: A few cushy pads to cover the ledge would make this reasonably safe, otherwise don't fall from the top.
content.location: Center of the tall slab on the north face of the boulder. There is a dike feature starting halfway up that is visible when standing below.

content.description:
Nice edges and good feet the whole way.

"Unknown Vb" in the book.
content.location:
Just right of the wide crack on the northwest side of the boulder. Shares a finish with the

Edge Traverse

.

content.description:
Sit start on the big holds down low and work up and left through a few more big holds. Pull up onto the white slab for the topout.

"Unnamed V2" in the book.
content.location:
Shares a start with

Edge Traverse

on big holds on the west side of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on a good jug rail, and work up and left before topping straight out over the slab.

"Unnamed V0" in the book.
content.location:
Southwest corner of the boulder, starting on a better jug rail in front of a tree to the left of the

Flake Snatcher

rail.
